page.title: 03TRANSPORT-RAILWAY.
page.content: Mr Ifor Williams has worked at Deganwy Station for 47 years,and feels that the L.M.S. was a better employer than British Rail.In 1950 the station was much busier than today.The average number of people travelling on the train for one week day in 1985 is 200 daily .In 1950 around 70 steam trains daily went towards Llandudno and 80 towards Llandudno Junction.Today 40 diesel engines go towards Llandudno and 45 towards Llandudno Junction.In 1950,eighty trains stopped daily in Deganwy,while today 64 stop.12 people, including a Station Master were employed in 1950,while today only four persons are employed without a Station Master.
